result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kathy A Snopek

defendant.name: Snopek, Kathy A
defendant.address: 2115 East St. Francis Avenue, St. Francis, WI 53235

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kathy A Snopek in court.  
Attorney Frank Joseph Schiro in court for Kathy A Snopek. 
Attorney Matthew Westphal for Nicolas J Heitman in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Plea Hearing. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
Court is in receipt Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum.  
Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
 
PLEA HEARING PROCEEDED: 

AS TO COUNT 1   
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.   
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea. 
 Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  
Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  . 
Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample nd advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 
Defense request time to  submit a PSI Report before sentencing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19. Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed: Defendant's Character Reference Letter
Received and Filed: Defendant's Character Reference Letter
Received and Filed: Defendant's Character Reference Letter

Defendant Kathy A Snopek in court with attorney Frank Joseph Schiro.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kathy A Snopek appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requested a plea hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45. 
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kathy A Snopek in court with attorney Frank Joseph Schiro.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court modified the no contact order to a no violent contact order. All other conditions remain as previously set.

Defendant Kathy A Snopek in court with Attorney Frank Joseph Schiro; both appear by video.  Nicolas Heitman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defense requests an arraignment date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 45.  Arraignment scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Oral No Contact Order with G.A.V.
Not to use any unauthorized use of financial instruments.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kathy A Snopek in court with attorney Frank Joseph Schiro.   Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Orally amended on Page 3 Snopek as power of attorney acted without GAV's consent.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/14/22 @ 1:30p
